issues.title: Links must be distinguishable without relying on color
issues.description: Ensure links are distinguished from surrounding text in a way that does not rely on color

relatedNodes.html: This record was published on April 8, 2016 by Equipo Nizkor and Derechos Human Rights. Under Title 17 U.S.C. Section 107, this info is shared freely to those who have shown a prior interest in getting the given details for research and learning reasons.

any.message: The link has insufficient color contrast of 2.23:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #0000ee, surrounding text: #000000)

relatedNodes.html: This record was published on April 8, 2016 by Equipo Nizkor and Derechos Human Rights. Under Title 17 U.S.C. Section 107, this info is shared freely to those who have shown a prior interest in getting the given details for research and learning reasons.

any.message: The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

  The link has insufficient color contrast of 2.23:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #0000ee, surrounding text: #000000)
  The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

issues.title: Links rely on color to be distinguishable.
issues.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. Link text that is discernible improves the experience for users with low vision. [Learn how to make links distinguishable](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/link-in-text-block).
